an4.246:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these four ways of lying down.
an4.246:4.3: The ways a corpse, a pleasure seeker, a lion, and a Realized One lie down.
an4.246:4.4: And how does a corpse lie down?
an4.246:4.5: Corpses usually lie flat on their backs.
an4.246:4.6: This is called the way a corpse lies down.
an4.246:5.1: And how does a pleasure seeker lie down?
an4.246:5.2: Pleasure seekers usually lie down on their left side.
an4.246:5.3: This is called the way a pleasure seeker lies down.
an4.246:6.1: And how does a lion lie down?
an4.246:6.2: The lion, king of beasts, lies down on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other, with his tail tucked between his thighs.
an4.246:6.3: When he wakes, he lifts his front quarters and checks his hind quarters.
an4.246:6.4: If he sees that any part of his body is disordered or untidy, he is displeased.
an4.246:6.5: But if he sees that no part of his body is disordered or untidy, he is pleased.
an4.246:6.6: This is called the way a lion lies down.
an4.246:7.1: And how does a Realized One lie down?
an4.246:7.2: It’s when a Realized One, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption … second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption.
an4.246:7.3: This is called the way a Realized One lies down.
an4.246:7.4: These are the four ways of lying down.”
